channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sam Altman says 1 million people signed up for ChatGPT in just 60 minutes after the company launched its viral image-generation feature
item.description: The OpenAI CEO said the new feature sparked "biblical demand."

item.title: ‘Our Kids Are the Least Flourishing Generation We Know Of’
item.description: The social psychologist Jonathan Haidt discusses the “parents’ revolution” on smartphones that his book “The Anxious Generation” has started.

item.title: 10,000 federal health workers are getting laid off, with many discovering they lost their jobs when their security badges didn’t work: ‘Is this an April Fool’s joke?’
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. announced a plan last week to remake the department.

item.title: Cory Booker just pulled an all-nighter on the Senate floor, protesting Trump’s agenda for more than 14 hours straight: ‘These are not normal times’
item.description: "The threats to the American people and American democracy are grave and urgent, and we all must do more to stand against them," he said.

item.title: What to Watch in Wisconsin’s Supreme Court Election and Florida’s Special Elections
item.description: Voters in a crucial court race and two House special elections will provide hints of how the country views President Trump and Elon Musk, months after...

item.title: Trump Aid Cuts End Contraception Access for Millions of Women
item.description: The United States was a key supplier of contraceptives in many developing countries. The Trump administration has ended that support.

item.title: Chinese Auto Giants Dongfeng and Changan Are in Talks to Merge
item.description: The state-owned automakers, longtime joint venture partners of Ford and Nissan, might combine operations as Beijing consolidates its sprawling car sec...

item.title: America’s largest public utility just appointed a new CEO less than a week after Trump mysteriously fired one of its board members without explanation
item.description: Don Moul, who's served as the Tennessee Valley Authority's executive vice president and COO since 2021, will now be in charge of the utility.

item.title: Shake Shack founder shares the green flags he looks for in new hires: ‘I really don’t give a damn what your IQ is’
item.description: Shake Shack founder Danny Meyer has high standards for new hires: even if they are highly capable, a lack of hospitality skills like integrity and wor...

item.title: The Irving Family Provides Many Jobs to a Canadian Province, But Also Draws Concerns
item.description: The Irving family businesses dominate Saint John, New Brunswick. They are a major employer, but residents say those jobs have come with a steep cost.

item.title: Trump Aid Cuts End Contraception Access for Millions of Women
item.description: The United States was a key supplier of contraceptives in many developing countries. The Trump administration has ended that support.

item.title: Italy Tightens Citizenship Rules Amid Influx of Applications
item.description: The government says it tightened citizenship rules because of a deluge of applications from the descendants of emigrants who only coveted an Italian p...

item.title: Iceland Volcano Eruption Near Grindavik Prompts Closure of Blue Lagoon
item.description: The eruption began near Grindavik, a small town long threatened by volcanic disruptions, and prompted the closure of a popular tourist destination.

item.title: The Irving Family Provides Many Jobs to a Canadian Province, But Also Draws Concerns
item.description: The Irving family businesses dominate Saint John, New Brunswick. They are a major employer, but residents say those jobs have come with a steep cost.

item.title: China’s Military Drills Around Taiwan Are a Warning to Its President
item.description: The drills came after Taiwan’s president, Lai Ching-te, announced measures to counter China’s influence and espionage. Beijing also wants to send a me...
